attack_methodology.evidence: Abstract (p. 1): "a robust physical adversarial example... in the physical world."

attack_objective.evidence: Sec. C (p. 19): "a more advanced disappearance attack... not to draw the bounding box of the object 'person'."

contribution_type.evidence: Abstract/Intro (p. 1): "we propose Adversarial T-shirts..." and "first work that models the effect of deformation... non-rigid objects such as T-shirts."

evaluation_aspects.evidence: Abstract (p. 1): "74%... digital and 57%... physical"; Sec. 4.2 (p. 10): "transfer single-detector attack"; Sec. 4.3 (p. 11): "compare our method with advPatch and advT-Affine".

evaluation_validity.evidence: Abstract (p. 1): "state-of-the-art physical attack method... only achieves 18% attack success rate."

representative_methods.evidence: Sec. 4 (p. 9): "we call advT-TPS"; "we call advT-Affine". Table 1 (p. 11): "advPatch[30]".

task.evidence: p. 1: "Evading Person Detectors in A Physical World."

title: Adversarial T-shirt! Evading Person Detectors in A Physical World
